title.narrative: WASH ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: Pacific Island Country Governments have strengthened institutional frameworks for equitable & sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene services, particularly in target countries., which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Sanitation, Social Protection, Water, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more Pacific children and their families, particularly the most vulnerable, are accessing adequate, equitable, affordable drinking water, sanitation and hygiene.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Pacific Island Country Governments have strengthened institutional frameworks for equitable & sustainable water, sanitation andhygiene services, particularly in target countries.

description.narrative: UNICEF Pacific support strengthened water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) data quality, monitoring, coordination and policies in Fiji, Kiribati, the Federated States of Micronesia (FSM), Solomon Islands and Vanuatu. The National Water and Sewerage Act in Fiji is under final review, and WASH in health care facilities (WinHCF) surveys were completed in 267 facilities in Solomon Islands, four in Kiribati and four in FSM. The multi-country Pacific WASH in schools (WinS) formative evaluation was completed, covering more than 600 schools. UNICEF sponsored 46 participants to attend the online WinHCF course. An additional US$9 million was leveraged. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/02/2022
